What Surprised You The Most in MR2?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Town Hall (Polls): Monster Rancher 2 Polls: What Surprised You The Most in MR2?
By Lisa Shock on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 05:54 pm:

Ok, Monster Rancher 2 has lots of little surprises: Binto's secret, a creepy doll that keeps moving around on its own, a dead tree springing to life, an explosion on expedition, visits from aliens, ec. What event in MR2 surprised you the most when it happened?

By locke on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 06:59 pm:

All of that stuff I took as regular game events. The one that really surprised me was when I had heard over and over how Colt never said anything new, and I thought I was already at that stage. Then one day we're at a tournament, and she smarted off to the advisors. I can't remember which one it was, but she basically called him boring and said he should just skip the speech. That really caught me off guard!

By Laura Parkinson on Monday, May 8, 2000 - 07:57 pm:

I haven't unlocked all that many monsters yet, or had that many special events happen. So what surprised me was when my little Skipper decided to go do his digging thing, and dug a little too deep...

That, and when my... well, one of the monters (I forget which one it was, offhand... I think it was a Nankyoro (sp?) decided to bring back something extra from an errantry.

By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, May 9, 2000 - 04:19 am:

pabs' harsh putdown of colt during the alien episode. this is the first time that tecmo allowed one of its "authority figures" to show himself as a dolt and a dunderhead...as the game went on, i found that it wasnt the last, either.

By Argos on Tuesday, May 9, 2000 - 07:49 am:

Pabs putting on the Joker mask.Some of the other events were just as surprising,but ......gwwmphhh....gahhhh... that was hilarious! I think Locke is referring to the legends cup after your 4th or 5th visit.

By PezCat on Tuesday, May 9, 2000 - 12:57 pm:

I'd have to agree with Argos. I was shocked, but adored the Kato's antics... the Jell surprised me with exactly how inventive they were with him... but by far the funniest thing was Pabs the dolt going "UMMMGAAAA..... GUAMMMMM" with the Joker Mask. I about fell off my bed
laughing as I watched that!

I was kinda surprised that they named "Whip" my Jell-Zuum's Forte when he made hall-of-fame status (my first Hall o' Famer! yay!). I may have used that 3 times? Only in an
attempt to end a battle where my opponent had been down to less than 10 Life. I expected Beam Gun at least...

PezCat

By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, May 9, 2000 - 04:25 pm:

pezcat, the same thing happened to me, and there is much discussion about it buried in a thread somewhere - maybe the one about darva. apparently, attacks used by the parents count toward forte for the offspring.

By Nate Railsback on Monday, May 15, 2000 - 12:33 am:

Personally, I sat straight up the first time I saw a Joker, and the first time I heard it giggle I cringed. I also cringed the first few times I heard a Centaur whinny in this game.

By phoenix masta on Monday, May 15, 2000 - 02:11 pm:

What really surprised me was the blue phoenix's stats. be seein' ya

By Wolvie on Monday, May 15, 2000 - 07:18 pm:

Hoppers gave you the finger. Those b*****ds. It should be rated M. Hehe Other than that NR2's got some of the ugliest and creepiest freaky monster in any game. I had only seen Suezo, Mocchi and a few others, mainly from the tv show, before I had played the game. I thought it'd be filled with cute monsters. That Hell Pierrot is something else.

By Dark Phoenix on Monday, May 15, 2000 - 09:44 pm:

As for the Hopper giving you "The Finger", it must be remembered that in Japan, where the game was created, "The Finger" gesture may have a much different, not to mention more polite, context. Just as some gestures that Americans consider friendly may mean something rude and boorish in Japan.

By Wolvie on Tuesday, May 16, 2000 - 07:58 pm:

I was just being funny. I was kinda surprised by that though. I wonder if its really is different in japan. anyone shed a light here? the game and monsters actually doesn't have a great japanimation feel to it. not as much as pokemon anyway. they're very varied and come from myths from all over the world.

By phoenix masta on Tuesday, June 6, 2000 - 08:30 pm:

actually I've changed my mind the most surprisiung thing is how weak Leo is. be seein' ya

By Kung Fu Hare on Thursday, June 8, 2000 - 07:46 am:

I think the most surprising thing would have to be that the mosters look fully grown when they're just born, except the fact that they're smaller! Suezo's don't have those cute lil' ears, and Naga's have big muscles as soon as they're born! What's with that?

By RNA on Thursday, June 8, 2000 - 10:18 pm:

I was most surprised when I found out how to unlock the Beaclon from B's old board. I couldn't believe such requirements could exist without any hint of meeting them are provided in the game itself.

By Spot on Friday, June 16, 2000 - 10:55 am:

I was really surprised when I tried the hatching trick from MR1 and my worm turned into a beaclon!

By ChunDog on Saturday, June 17, 2000 - 12:17 pm:

The "Ending". I was hopin' it would be better.

By torey_luvullo on Saturday, June 17, 2000 - 03:54 pm:

i have to agree about that, chundog. maybe it goes with a game thats capable of being played forever, but both games disappointed me with how little really happened when you achieved master level.

By lovesaurian on Friday, June 30, 2000 - 01:44 pm:

Changed my mind it is...

"Colt what r u doing!"
"What's wrong master!"
"And you too Lisa!"
Here i did not know what to think...i thought he was on to me for trying to kill my monster (don't remember why).

This is when u upgrade ur stable for the second time.

By Melenium Link on Tuesday, July 11, 2000 - 06:44 pm:

The crappyness of the game, lot of arguments coming... Melenium Link Out~

By jovial evil on Saturday, October 14, 2000 - 03:29 pm:

was the level of skill it takes to gat an HOF monster, all the little things you wouldnt normally worry about, its not a kids game..

By Carl Carlisle on Saturday, November 18, 2000 - 12:50 am:

It was Karn that Colt called boring. You know how some old geezers will just talk on and on about the same thing, until everyone is put to sleep. Well Colt was just giving a typical reaction as he was giving details concerning the tournement for the dragon thingie. But it's natural for him to get carried away since he's obviously an expert researcher in the feild. Scientists especially get so emotional about their favorite subjects, that they lose all track of time when they expound upon such matters. They're constantly reliving all of their favorite details and experiances even as they're talking. And, considering that there are so many fields and branches related to even just one closely studied subject, such as the rare dragon, the information accumulated so far could seem endless to some. Actually, the scientific study of any subject is endless. Karn, having lived as long as he has must've had alot of exciting details and experiances that he wanted to relate; thinking that his captive audiance would be just as interested and entertained as he was. I don't think that it would have occurred to him, that anyone would've considered one of his favorite subjects as less than exciting. In fact, he'd probably be suprised to find out that people weren't sitting on the edge of their seats in awe of the fantastic information concerning the dragon. So in short, Colt's reaction may not have really been all that remarkable; since older people will get carried away with talking a subject to death. What really suprised me was that I couldn't transfer my 'Eve' pixie from my slate. Bummer.

By cactusman on Saturday, December 9, 2000 - 01:19 am:

Phoenix coming out of the volcano suprised a lot!

By Gokou on Saturday, December 9, 2000 - 10:00 am:

What really caught me off gaurd was the cenatur attacking the farm. It made me jump because I wasn't looking at the screen until I heard my hare punching over and over again, I had a lot of bass on the tv and it was real loud.

Is there any other time a monster will attack the ranch?

KAO'KEN

By mamemon master on Friday, December 15, 2000 - 09:42 am:

By Nightdagger on Wednesday, August 15, 2001 - 03:14 am:

7th: Oh, Mr.(insert name here) and Coltia! So nice to see you! Please pick a location! Oh, I am afraid there is no chance of a technique in that location...Oh, yes, you can get a technique there, It is almost certain...Oh, yes, thank you, you've done it again! Here's the money! Come again!
